image.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India

item.title: 'Why wouldn't there be a regime change?': Trump's 'hint' after Op Midnight Hammer in Iran
item.description: Donald Trump seemingly endorsed regime change in Iran, questioning why it wouldn't occur if the current regime fails to improve the nation. This contrasts with his administration's earlier statements, where officials like JD Vance, Marco Rubio, and Pete Hegseth asserted that the recent US air strikes on Iranian nuclear sites were not aimed at toppling the government.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Middle East conflict: Could Iran's nuclear sites turn toxic? Experts weigh risks after US and Israeli strikes
item.description: Following US and Israeli airstrikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, concerns are rising about potential regional contamination. While the IAEA hasn't detected increased radiation, experts warn of the dangers from released toxic chemicals like uranium hexafluoride. Attacks on enrichment sites pose chemical risks, but a strike on the Bushehr nuclear power plant could trigger a catastrophic radiological disaster.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Our boys in those bombers...': Pete Hegseth slammed for 'sexism' during Pentagon briefing on Iran strike
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Midnight Hammer: Vance hails pilots and other members for strikes on Iran; 'would have been impossible without perfect coordination'
item.description: US Vice President JD Vance lauded the American military's operation against Iranian nuclear sites, praising the coordination and discretion of the president's national security team. Stealth bombers targeted key facilities in Fordow, Isfahan, and Natanz, using bunker-buster bombs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Steve Bannon know about Operation Midnight Hammer? His 'party is on' dropped the first clue
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel-Iran conflict: Another evacuation flight from Iran lands in Delhi with 311 Indians
item.description: India evacuated 311 more citizens from Mashhad on Sunday. The special flight landed in Delhi. This brought the total evacuees to 1,428 under Operation Sindhu. The operation aims to bring back Indian nationals from Iran and Israel. Evacuation flights operated from Mashhad, Yerevan, and Ashgabat. India is monitoring the regional situation for safe return of citizens.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Middle East conflict: Iran fires ‘Kheybar Shekan’ missile at Israel for first time after US strikes - Why it matters?
item.description: Iran's IRGC launched a barrage of 40 ballistic missiles, including the Kheybar Shekan, targeting Israeli cities after US strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities. The attacks, which caused injuries and triggered air raid sirens, highlight the escalating conflict. Israel's defense systems faced challenges from the new generation of missiles due to their maneuverability.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Decisive leadership': Nikki Haley, Mike Pence approve of Trump's 'Operation Midnight Hammer' on Iran
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US strikes Iran: How Tom Cruise's Top Gun: Maverick eerily predicted Donald Trump's Operation Midnight Hammer
item.description: In June 2025, President Trump—new term, same instincts—ordered a real-world operation that bore eerie resemblance to Maverick. Seven B-2 bombers took off from the US under the cloak of midnight. The mission: Operation Midnight Hammer. The target: Iran’s Fordow uranium enrichment facility, buried in the mountains near Qom. A site designed to withstand everything short of Armageddon. A site built for this very moment.
item.dc:creator: Nirmalya Dutta

item.title: Global powers urge restraint after US strikes Iran; Tehran vows retaliation; PM Modi, Starmer, Erdogan respond to crisis
item.description: The United States launched targeted airstrikes on Iranian nuclear sites, escalating the Israel-Iran conflict. President Trump hailed the operation as a success, while Iran condemned it and vowed retaliation. International leaders and organizations warned against further escalation, with Turkey cautioning of catastrophic consequences and India calling for de-escalation and diplomacy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'We have other goals': Israeli army vows to continue Iran offensive; reviews aftermath of US strikes on nuclear sites
item.description: Amid escalating regional tensions, the Israeli military declared it has "other goals" in Iran and will press forward with its military campaign, hours after US air strikes hit key Iranian nuclear facilities. Israel launched fresh attacks, targeting Iranian missile launchers, while Tehran accused the US and Israel of inflaming the crisis, marking a serious escalation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What is Operation Midnight Hammer? US reveals details of 'deliberate, precise' strike on Iran
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran eyes retaliation after US airstrikes: Key American bases now in crosshairs
item.description: In a significant escalation, the US has launched airstrikes targeting Iranian nuclear sites, including Fordo, Isfahan, and Natanz, using powerful bunker-buster bombs. Iran has warned of a decisive response, raising concerns about regional security. Key US military installations like Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar and the US Navy's Fifth Fleet in Bahrain are potential targets for Iranian retaliation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US strikes Iran: How legendary 88-year-old reporter Seymour Hersh scooped that Donald Trump would attack Iranian nuclear sites
item.description: On June 19, Hersh published a detailed report via his Substack newsletter, claiming that US B-2 bombers and naval platforms were preparing a "coordinated assault" on Iran’s underground nuclear sites at Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan. The piece cited unnamed sources in the intelligence community who warned that the operation was imminent and being conducted with minimal oversight...
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
